title: Genre: Poetry
objective: Read Hebrew poetry with attention to parallelism and imagery

required_passages.text: The heavens declare the glory of God, and the sky proclaims His handiwork. Day to day pours out speech, and night to night reveals knowledge. Their voice goes out through all the earth. The sun is like a bridegroom coming from his chamber and like a strong man running his course with joy; nothing is hidden from its heat.

segments.audio_script: This is lesson eight. Focus on poetry: parallelism, meter, and imagery.

Listen to the passage. Psalm 19:1-6. The heavens declare the glory of God, and the sky proclaims His handiwork. Day to day pours out speech, and night to night reveals knowledge. Their voice goes out through all the earth. The sun is like a bridegroom coming from his chamber and like a strong man running his course with joy; nothing is hidden from its heat. Now identify the poetic parallels and images, and explain how they reinforce the main claim.
Hebrew poetry uses parallel lines to develop thought. Recognize metaphors and symbolic language.

vocabulary.definition: Poetic device where lines correspond in meaning or contrast

study_notes: Poetry frequently communicates theological depth through compact imagery; careful attention to line relations is required.
